headline: Great Company and Great Mission!
pros:
- Great Benefits
- Creative, driven, and hard working colleagues
- Global teams = diverse perspectives 
- Focused on growth mindset leadership 
- Great for beginning and mid career growth.
cons:
- Since it's global, it never "shuts off" - meetings can sometimes be early or late in the day
- Extremely fast paced, decisions sometimes made w/o consults, or decision not made because too many "cooks in the kitchen" 
- If you are outside of the SF offices, it can be sometimes hard to connect with other staff.
advice_to_mgmt: Please continue to focus on diverse hiring, more women, LGBTQIA+, and POC in leadership roles (including the board and all the way up to E-Staff).

headline: Great Company, Great Culture
pros: Lots of opportunities for growth, fun work environment, wonderful co-workers, employee resources groups and volunteer activities, great benefits, stocks, etc
cons: Convoluted processes, everyone laid off

headline: N/A
pros: take care of all employees
cons: not thing that I can comment on

headline: An Incredible Place to Wok
pros: Airbnb is genuine and honest. Pursuing, not only, the betterment of their employees and customers but the global world. Airbnb aims to create a world where you can belong anywhere.
cons: Airbnb's hypergrowth has caused growing pains at times and being an employee means that you're along for that ride and all that comes along with it.
advice_to_mgmt: Stay true to the mission you started with to make the world better.

headline: UX designer
pros: Good experience and chances to learn more
cons: Less opportunities for end to end ux design

headline: great job
pros: great culture that helps you remain competitive.
cons: Not to many things to complain about

headline: Too young of a company - no one seems to care or be a watch dog
pros: Innovate... moving fast - you can learn alot
cons: Growing too fast. Employees in roles with no real experience but education. Huge imbalance.
advice_to_mgmt: I worked supporting the talent team for 1 year globally. I found the inner dynamics to be hostile at best. My indirect manager would micromanage my work, talk poorly about me to my peers and my employees, belittle me in meetings, and orchestrate situations for her sick pleasure. Her leader seemed aloof and unengaged - It was hostile - she was left with a lot of responsibility and she bred an environment of nastiness. Airbnb prides itself on having a great working environment and superb ethics and values but treats their vendors, freelancers, temps, and contractors like garbage. Airbnb was one of the worst experiences in the workforce I have ever had as I was hospitalized for stress. The only thing Airbnb gave me was depression and anxiety.

headline: Great mission, amazing people, lots of swirl
pros:
Mission driven company
Incredible people 
Talent top notch 
You get to travel 
Amazing benefits
cons:
Tons of swirl
Constant change and lack of clear vision
Management is not in touch with day to day needs 
Can’t finish projects
advice_to_mgmt: Please try to set clear vision and listen to the employees they are overworked and can’t focus

headline: neural
pros: good health benefits. Fast pace
cons: overworked. low pay. little growth

headline: Operations Manager
pros: nice people, especially the staff
cons: too big, a little too impersonal

pros: Great culture and disruptive product. Breakfast, lunch and dinner provided (when we were in the office).
cons: Finance org is very bulky and processes are poor

headline: Fox and the vines
pros: Great local food and wines. Country drives, and not far from the city
cons: Since this is my place, I might be a bit one sided. The goal is to make improvements thru feedback and observations.
advice_to_mgmt: Always listen to your wife, fresh flowers make for a great greeting.

headline: Truly One-of-a-Kind Place
pros:
-Outstanding, inspiring and compassionate leadership
-Genuine commitment to being an outstanding place to work
-Lovely and talented people
cons: -Can be slow to move but also understandable given its scale
advice_to_mgmt: While I no longer worked there at the time, I applaud the way you handled the 2020 layoff. That was exemplary leadership.

headline: Review
pros: Great perks and benefits, good comp plans, amazing culture, founders care about people
cons: Disorganized leaders, constant changes in strategy and priorities

headline: Great culture (while I was there)
pros: The team and people are what kept people going to work everyday. There were always opportunities to develop. People care about their job and the others around them.
cons: It's somewhat unknown what's happened at Airbnb. Seems like there've been difficulties financially and it's resulted in downsizing the team. It's unfortunate.

headline: best job
pros: cleaning working alone pay on schedule.
cons: sometimes the location and avaiability
advice_to_mgmt: i am a hard worker and dependable.ive worked for multiple cleaning services and know what im doing.

headline: Good place for product engineers to work
pros: Product driven, great design, very nice people
cons: Infrastructure and dev tooling lacking, testing is hard

headline: Overrated
pros:
- high growth
- great culture and employees
cons:
- CEO is all over the place 
- takes forever to get things done, get projects through the finish line
- Leadership for virtually every department has changed in past year

headline: Amazing company, but "Kumbaya"culture trips up creating an efficient work place
pros: Great pay & outstanding office space before Covid-19 Layoffs
cons: Culture of "Belonging" empowered ineffective people & ideas to gain more traction than they should have because speaking out against lackluster ideas could be seen as against company culture/values

headline: Good Company
pros: Good company and good benefits
cons: Hit hard by COVID 19

headline: Great Brand, Solid Business Model, Questionable Leadership
pros:
Brand Recognition (Airbnb is noun and verb)
Asset-light business model
Mission driven and long term focused company
Founders remain at Company
Compensation is relatively high with a good WLB
Generally very nice people across the company
Strong diversity push and URMs have greater career growth opportunities
cons:
Increased regulation on short term rentals
Business is severely impacted by downturns in travel (e.g COVID travel restrictions)
Company has outgrown the CEO (seems more suited to a non profit or politics)
Immature/weak Leadership and Management for Company of this size
Prevalent woke culture (not really a safe space for right leaning ideologies)

headline: Overall, great place to work.
pros: Benefits, culture, food team, travel credit, office.
cons: Not the most competitive pay

headline: Fun Company
pros: Healthy work atmosphere, good pay.
cons: Not a lot of opportunity to move up in the company.
advice_to_mgmt: Consider promoting more of your executives from inside the company.

headline: Awesome environment
pros: Have learned a ton, great salary
cons: None, everything is great here

headline: great place to work
pros: great team and fun place to work!
cons: lack of career development and some managers were not incredibly supportive

headline: Great place to work!
pros:
Caring coworkers
Great leaders
Beautiful office space
Delicious and healthy food/snacks
Great product
cons:
Career mobility is difficult 
COVID-19 hit the business hard
Layoffs impacted culture
advice_to_mgmt: Help your team with career development by encouraging them to take grow@ classes

headline: It was good while it lasted
pros: benefits and culture and the teams
cons: They laid off Portland office due to Covid only to retrain which is almost 500 ppl, to rehire in Montreal. The sense of BELONGING was taken from us.

headline: All in all, a fantastic company
pros: Wholesome company culture + Intelligent and goodhearted coworkers
cons: Reorgs are common and can be disruptive to work projects
